hackathon-description-text: Taking place from November 4th - 6th at Trent University's Peter Gzowski Building, 400 students will compete to create software and hardware projects within 36 hours. With companies such as TribalScale, TD, BlackBerry and FreshBooks attending, there will be many opportunities for students to engage representatives and inquire about future career opportunites.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: VP of Technology Innovation at TD
President & CEO - Greater Peterborough Innovation Cluster

hackathon-eligibility: Any student who has hacked at and been accepted to Electric City Hacks is able to submit a project.
hackathon-rules:
The Electric City Hacks organizing team reserves the right to disqualify project submissions that do not adhere to the following guidelines. Please contact an Electric City Hacks organizer if you have any questions regarding these guidelines.

Projects can be completed individually or in a group with a maximum size of 4 students. All team members must be approved, registered Electric City Hacks attendees present at the event.

All code written for Electric City Hacks must be written between 10:00PM on Friday, November 4th, 2016 and 10:00AM on Sunday, November 6th, 2016 with the exception of code taken from public and open source libraries, APIs, or tutorials.

All hardware assembled for Electric City Hacks must be assembled between 10:00PM on Friday November 4th and 10:00AM on Sunday November 6th, with the exception of manufactured parts that do not require soldering or assembly with a breadboard outside of the factory (such as robotic arms, Myos, or 3D printed parts).

All art assets brought into Electric City Hacks for your project must be free and publicly available.

Students are free to bring codeless wireframes for the layout of their projects. Hardware may be prototyped in advance to optimize the shape and size of parts, but the actual project presented for submission must be assembled at Electric City Hacks.

The final product must be original: it must not be the same as the product of a tutorial, a submission to a previous hackathon, or a personal project completed before Electric City Hacks. Attendees are trusted to ensure the originality of their projects in good faith. Electric City Hacks retains the right to inspect the source code of projects in case of dispute. All projects and intellectual property produced at Electric City Hacks belong to the attendees who produced it.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hardware Hack - Presented by IEEE

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A gift card to a project management bootcamp, including certification as a professional project manager.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Display of Project Management - Presented by Peter Northrop
Most Innovative Hack - Presented by IEEE
Best Interdisciplinary Hack - Presented by Electric City Hacks

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Inspired by the Apps for Ag Competition at AG 4.0
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Agritech Hack - Presented by the Peterborough Agricultural Society
Best Use of AWS Presented by MLH

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive. Prize: Collector's Edition of Watch Dogs 2
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best FinTech Hack Presented by FreshBooks

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Participants must have attended 2 or fewer hackathons cumulatively.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Beginner Hack Presented by ECH

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Don't forget to checkout the perfect pitch workshop at 6PM (Saturday) in FPHL-117!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Green Hack Presented by TD

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2510 Pioneer Rd, Peterborough, ON K9L 1Z8, Canada
hackathon-location-address: 2510 Pioneer Rd, Peterborough, ON K9L 1Z8, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Electric City Hacks is the first of many hackathons to be hosted at Trent University. We welcome all students that wish to apply themselves and are fascinated by new technologies!
